title: Add safe-area padding and compact routine containers

requirements.summary: Add safe-area padding to Header component for iOS Dynamic Island and Android notches/punch-holes
acceptanceCriteria: Header has top padding that respects device safe-area-inset-top
Header content is not obscured by iOS Dynamic Island or Android notches/punch-holes
Safe-area padding is applied using CSS environment variables

file_operations.description: Add CSS env(safe-area-inset-top) padding to the header container element to accommodate iOS Dynamic Island and Android notches/punch-holes. Apply the padding using inline style or className that references the CSS environment variable, ensuring header content (logo, date, auth controls, theme toggle) is not obscured by device cutouts.

requirements.summary: Reduce Morning and Evening routine container heights by 50% in MorningRoutine component
acceptanceCriteria: Morning routine container height is reduced by 50%
Evening routine container height is reduced by 50%
All routine functionality (drag-and-drop, checkboxes, add/delete) remains intact
Routine items remain readable and interactive after height reduction

file_operations.description: Reduce the height of the Morning and Evening routine container elements by 50% to make them more compact. Modify the height-related CSS classes or inline styles for both routine section containers while preserving all existing functionality including drag-and-drop reordering, checkbox interactions, add/delete operations, and two-column display mode. Ensure routine items remain readable and interactive after the height reduction.
